intro: Acourtia tenoriensis, commonly known as the Tenoriensis acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and coastal climates. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the spring, and it is often found in coastal scrub habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
